reviewText: This is great for the kids that DBZ appeals to. Many grown-ups are fans of this series... those grown-ups have kids... the kids take an interest because  Daddy likes this show... but not all of the DBZ stuff is okay for the 5 year old to watch... this is where this friendly set comes in... This set was not made for the Die Hard fan. It is like an INTRO to DBZ, and when that 5 year old gets to be 7 or 10 they can become even more interested with the universe of DBZ.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This dvd covers the first 13 episodes of Dragon Ball.  It is very funny and begins the buildup of the characters for Dragon Ball-Z later on.  I enjoyed these episodes, but was disappointed that an unedited version was not available. There are many funny jokes that are cut out, to make this appropriate for very young viewers. As of yet Funimation and Pinoneer still do not get it that Dragon Ball and the later series were not intended for just little kids. There editing has destroyed the humor Akira Toriyama originally intended.  The English dubbing is pretty good though, with some of the voices that occur later on in Dragon Ball Z. I only wish that they could have made an unedited version, because the best of this dvd is cut out.
summary: Great Buy if you don't mind the editing
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dragonball is a really funny series, so I was very much looking forward to buying the DVD...until I saw it was only available edited and dubbed. WTF? I know the DB series, especially the original, are very popular among children. But there are many fans over 18 that would just like to enjoy the series without the nonsense editing. Have two versions - one edited English dub only, and one bilingual uncut. And I mean UNCENSORED as well as uncut. Give people the option to choose. I really don't get it. Doesn't Funimation WANT money?And another thing, what is the deal with certain parents demanding that DBZ and DB be edited? Did you perhaps not realize it is insanely violent? Just because it vaguely resembles Disney doesn't mean it has that same level of child friendly quality. And since when did we start editing cartoons? Why was Wiley E. Coyote and Popeye good enough for my parents to watch, but now all of a sudden I can't see it uncut? Where's Mighty Mouse to save us from this nonsense?This whole censoring garbage has gone too far. Did you know that Crystal Communications recently banned songs from their radio stations that are anyway even remotely related to NY's WTC attacks? Everyone from Megadeth to Buddy Holly. Frank Sinatra's "New York, New York" is banned! Ridiculous!Oops, I started ranting. To sum up: DB is funny. DB on DVD censored is NOT funny.

reviewText: This set contains the first 13 episodes of the phenomenon that is Dragon Ball. The Dragon Ball franchise has been my favorite anime since I can remember. This story is about a young boy named Goku. He meets a girl named Bulma and their epic journey to find seven magical orbs known as Dragon Balls begins. Once found, the seven orbs can grant any person a wish.Specifically, this set contains the first 13 episodes of the show, however, the dubbed voices used are ridiculously bad and out of date. Also, the episodes are edited to the point where it will make you want to scream. The original Japanese version isn't even available. This set also comes with the Dragon Ball movie, Curse of the Blood Rubies, but that is also horribly dubbed. This is a very poorly done set that doesn't do this series justice. It's sad that the first episodes of this legendary show were so very poorly dubbed. Get these only if you are a true fan. Otherwise, try to see these episodes somewhere, but start with the Tournament Saga if you are considering buying any Dragon Ball DVDs, it is done much better.

reviewText: If you get this along with Funimation's recent Rock the Dragon Collector's edition, you'll have all of the North American released episodes of the Ocean Group dub, which while oftentimes grossly inconsistent with the original production and censored to kingdom come, is still a really great performance, with great voice casting choices and sound production that make for some very good, kid-friendly entertainment.  I love this set and pop it into my DVD player all the time, it makes for great ambient entertainment.

reviewText: Reading the reviews, I became tired of people trashing the english dub of the TV series of Dragonball.I enjoyed the voices & the dialogue ie writing of the first 13 episodes, especially Bulma, Shao, Pilaf, Yamcha, Ooolong, Turtle, the announcer & Puar vs the replacements they got for the mentioned characters in later episodes.I found the writing to be extremely funny in a post-modern way ie in the first episode when the pre-historic bird grabs bulma & is flying away, he says: "Stop screaming, I'm in the mood for a happy meal".Contrast this extremely funny dialogue vs Japanese version:  "It's been a long time since I had a human. I going to enjoy you, skin and all". THis I thought was less funny & a bit disgusting if you think about it.As stated earlier, I have seen the Jap version later and although it was good bec of the perverted version, I found the voices for puar, oolong, Yamcha, Ox-king at bit off-putting and the dialogue to be very conventional.I loved the English shao & pilaf voices in the 13 episodes vs japanese versions of shao & pilafI enjoyed watching the cut dragonballs & comparing it w/ the uncut bec it was fun to see how they could change/edit to make sense of what was happening.The only reason to watch uncut is to see Master Roshi in "action". Otherwise there is no reason to really see it uncut.And character-wise, the set is more character-driven vs action driven in later dragonball episodes.I wish that dragonball would spin-off stand-along version Master Roshi, Bulma, Lunch, Oolong w/o goku as an un-cut series . I find the fighing to be annoying in later Dragonball & especially Dragonball Z.
summary: loved english dub for its post-modern spin
Title: N/A

reviewText: As you know from my last few reviews, I hate the first arc of Dragonball uncut.  So this DVD is a real blessing for me.  Yeah I know I'm in the minority but I don't care.  I'm happy, and that's all that matters.  And for $4 this was a real deal.As I should've mentioned before but you've no doubt guessed by now, I prefer to watch Dragonball (as well as Z & GT) in English.  The Japanese voices are actually annoying, mainly in that many of the male characters are voiced by females (Goku, Krillin, Yajirobe & Gohan) that never change (the Japanese voices of Goku & Krillin were okay when they were kids; not so okay when they grew up).  & I hate how Goku's voice actress voices every male in his family (Goku, Gohan, Goten, Bardock (!) & even Turles, the villain from the 3rd Z movie).  To say nothing of the vulgar & lame dialogue (they break the fourth wall sometimes).  So unless I happen to stumble across the edited versions of the new dub on VHS, I'm stuck with this.  And to be honest, I probably wouldn't trade it anyways.  The editing isn't as bad as when Dragonball Z was first dubbed.  The voices are pretty good, sometimes even better than Funimation's cast.  My favorites are Yamcha & Puar.  Puar's voice is kind of annoying at times, but here she's perfect.  & Christopher Sabat's Yamcha is good, but he sounds a little too much like a surfer dude for me at times.  Ted Cole is just perfect.  Even DBZ Uncensored said he might even make a better Yamcha than his Japanese voice actor!  And the music isn't bad.  I actually like the soundtrack, enough to have the CD for it.  Not as good as the Japanese music of course, but not bad.  And the dialogue here is just about perfect 99% of the time.  There are some lines that make me cringe ("Goku sounds like go poo!") but those are few & far between.I also like how they put the movie on here too.  One afternoon long ago, my cousin who loved DBZ as much as I did showed me the movie to introduce me to Dragonball.  I loved it back then, now I really like it.  Alright, so it doesn't really improve on the episodes here in fact, to be honest it's something of a downgrade.  But still, on its own it's a great movie.  Basically, this movie is Dragonball 101.  If you have someone you want to introduce Dragonball too, showing them this would be a good idea.  It's not the best of the movies, but it's not the worst (that shame goes to Broly Second Coming).So overall, this is an awesome set in my humble opinion.  By the way, if you're not going to buy this set DON'T GIVE IT A BAD REVIEW!  If you've gotten the set & are disappointed with it I can understand but if you've just heard about & don't intend to buy it don't knock the rating down any further than it already is.
summary: God bless whoever decided to release this on DVD!

reviewText: i hated to leave this rating but i must grade it as 1 star. . . .  im a fan of the whole DragonBall/Z/GT anime and i was so happy to see that DragonBall was on DVD but this saga is edited so crappily and so terribly that its so noticible that it was edited. i showed this series to my cousin who is 9 years old and even he noticed the terrible editing and voice-overs  i was and AM disappointed in this saga  i DONT recommend you to buy this saga for it is NOT true to the anime style. . . .  i am however thankful that the other sagas of DragonBall are being released as UNCUT  i recommend you to skip this saga and just buy the others going from the Tournement Saga all the way to Piccolo Junior Saga. ;_; i pray that Funimation will release an uncut version soon cause we NEED it and we deserve it

reviewText: Ok I will admit I am 13, and started watching the later sagas of DBZ instead of most people who watched the first series and then the beginings of DBZ. So I bought this set to watch to sort of fill me in on what happened during Dragonball (the flash backs in DBZ dont tell much). First of all until I got it home and watched it I had no idea that it was edited, I ould have preferred unedited but I said ok so what it is edited. I watched it and found that it wasn't as funny as DBZ was, I am not much for toilet humor and the funniest part was the part where Bulma gives Goku a bath and then Goku walks in on Bulma while she is taking a bath in episode 1. Sence I have purchased this set I have only watched it once, maybe a few episodes twice. All in all, I hated it and do recomend it for younger kids who like the "fart" and "poop" jokes. For the 12+ catagory just steer clear.
summary: I thought this was an ok Dragonball

reviewText: If you are wondering why the first boxed set of the Dragon Ball series is edited while the others are uncut it is because Funimation doesn't have the rights to these first set of episodes (Pioneer has them, I think). According to Funimation, they should get the rights back some time in 2004, and they promised to released an uncut version at that time. So, if you are like me wanting to watch this exellent series from episode one in all its uncut glory will have to wait until then.

reviewText: After watching this one can tell that this was not the recent releases done on cartoon network.  If anything after watching this it brings back the thought that this was once released years ago in a severly edited format.  Not to say that this is bad or anything because for the most part the story arcs are still there.  However the most comedic elements of these episodes like when goku first heres about a bath and Bulma has to bathe him, or the severe pervertedness of Master Roshi are all edited out and replaced with dialouge that is corny or removed entirly.  This is an allright set at the right price, and good for little kids.  But for fans who have been getting the sagas that funimation has been releasing as of late, I would not bother.

reviewText: You will just love this set.  I gave it four stars because it was censored to much so it looks like a kid show, as Dragonball, DBZ, and DBGT are  targeted to adults 18 and over, but this is still a very enjoyable tape to  watch.  Unlike Dragonball Z and Dragonball GT, Dragonball gives more  information, so that later in the series, there can be a lot of action  scenes without people getting confused.  This set has all the Dragonball  tapes that FUNimation dubbed, about 1/4 of the episodes are here, all the  English ones.  I watched Dragonball on Fox a long time ago, and I still  watch it now, as it's still better than watching DBZ crap that Funimation  did on UPN and Cartoon Network.  Get this set!
